  • Cats (1998)

    The show that changed the face of modern musicals. Andrew Lloyd Webber's "Cats", one of the most famous musicals of all time, first exploded onto the West End stage in 1981. 'Memory', one of its many classic songs, became an instant worldwide hit.
    Since then Cats has smashed records and conquered the world. Boasting an all-star cast headed by Elaine Paige and Sir John Mills, breathtaking visuals and the full digital sound of an eighty piece orchestra...
    Director:
    David Mallet
    Cast:
    Elaine Paige, Paul Baker, John Mills
    Formats:

    Blanket must overcome his fear and painful past, with the help of Macaw.

  • Cats (2019)

    Academy-Award-winning director Tom Hooper transforms Andrew Lloyd Webber's record-shattering musical into a cinematic event.
    Starring James Corden, Judi Dench, Jason Derulo, Idris Elba, Jennifer Hudson, Ian McKellen, Taylor Swift, Rebel Wilson and introducing Royal Ballet principal Francesca Hayward. With a world-class cast of dancers showcasing styles from classical ballet to contemporary, hip-hop to jazz, street dance to tap, this film reimagines the stage musical for a new generation. You will believe in the fun and magic of 'Cats'.
    Director:
    Tom Hooper
    Cast:
    James Corden, Judi Dench, Jason Derulo

  • Stray Cats: Live at Rockpalast (1983)

    When the Stray Cats entered the stage in the 80s, rockabilly was hot. Grease quiffs and tattoos were the outside badges; upright drums and bass the characteristic instruments.
    The charismatic trio of guitarist/singer Brian Setzer, upright bassist/singer Lee Rocker and drummer Slim Jim Phantom was founded in New York in 1979. Their first album was produced by Dave Edmunds in London and rapidly appeared on the British charts. It was the mixture of traditional rockabilly and new wave which helped quickly popularize the Stray Cats all around the world.

    Open Air Loreley, August 20th 1983
    1. Baby Blue Eyes
    2. Double Talkin' Baby
    3. Rumble in Brighton
    4. Drink That Bottle Down
    5. Something is Wrong with My Radio
    6. Built for Speed

  • Cats in the Museum (2023)Koty Ermitazha

    "Cats in the Museum" is a captivating film that invites you into a world hidden within the historic museum's walls. Here, a group of clever cats, led by the charming Max, comes to life after dark.
    Their peaceful existence is threatened when the museum faces closure, jeopardizing not only their home but also iconic artworks like the Mona Lisa. In their mission to save the museum, these resourceful feline heroes encounter a new challenge: mischievous mice with a penchant for nibbling on priceless masterpieces. The cats, determined to protect the Mona Lisa and other treasured artworks, embark on daring escapades to outwit the mice and preserve the cultural heritage that resides within their beloved museum. This film weaves together elements of adventure, humour, and heart, all while celebrating the enduring spirit of these museum-dwelling cats and their mission to safeguard artistic treasures against all odds. Join them on a thrilling journey through art, history, and the power of teamwork.
    Director:
    Vasiliy Rovenskiy
    Cast:
    Roman Kurtsyn, Jordan Worsley, Polina Gagarina
    Formats:
    Sign up

  • At Night All Cats Are Black (2022)De noche los gatos son pardos

    A crew is shooting a libertine costume film when Valentin (Valentin Merz), the director, suddenly disappears. While the local police investigate, the film shoot continues but takes an odd turn. Robin (Robin Mognetti), the cameraman and director's lover, follows a promise.
    Paying homage to underground queer cinema "At Night All The Cats Are Black" is shameless, witty, erotic, and tender. Driven by the right to lose oneself and feel lost in life, in filmmaking and in sex
    Director:
    Valentin Merz
    Cast:
    Robin Mognetti, Valentin Merz, Jean-Charles de Quillacq
    Formats:
    Sign up

  • Cats and Dogs: Paws Unite! (2020)Cats and Dogs 3: Paws Unite!

    It's been 10 years since the creation of the Great Truce, an elaborate joint-species surveillance system designed and monitored by cats and dogs to keep the peace when conflicts arise.
    But when a tech-savvy villain hacks into wireless networks to use frequencies only heard by cats and dogs, he manipulates them into conflict and the worldwide battle between cats and dogs is Back On. Now, a team of inexperienced and untested agents will have to use their old-school animal instincts to restore order and peace between cats and dogs everywhere.
    Director:
    Sean McNamara
    Cast:
    Edwin Perez, Callum Seagram Airlie, Andrea Libman
    Formats:
    Sign up

  • Big Cats (2018)

    One Family, 40 Faces, Many Secrets. One group of animals fascinates and enthrals us more than any other, captivating and terrifying in equal measure - the cats. 'Big Cats' is the ultimate celebration of the entire cat family.
    The planet's top predators and everyone's favourite animals, as you've never seen them before. Latest developments in filming technology, and a surge in cat research, bring these superstars into the spotlight. Combining fascinating behaviours with amazing stories, the series reflects the true nature of cats - and reveals how they still have the power to surprise. Earth's ultimate predator is drawn out of the shadows.
    Director:
    Sara Douglas
    Cast:
    Not Available
    Formats:
    Sign up

  • Animal Planet: Big Cats: Into the Lion's Den (2004)

    Protected by only a stick with a miniature camera on it, zoologist and big cat trainer Dave Salmoni is on a mission to prove that humans can live in harmony with wild lions.
    He is pioneering a new research project that has never been attempted before, removing the barrier between man and beast by walking in on a pride of lions to observe, learn the language, and gain social acceptance. "Into the Lion's Den" brings viewers to the edge of human-animal interaction.
    Director:
    Anton Truesdale
    Cast:
    Dave Salmoni
    Formats:
    Sign up

  • Stray Cats: Live at Montreux 1981 (1981)

    In 1981 the Stray Cats arrived in Montreux for what would be their only appearance at the festival. They were on peak form with their eponymous debut album riding high in the charts.
    The show features all their early hit singles including "Runaway Boys", "Stray Cat Strut" and "Rock This Town" plus many other live favourites to deliver an evening of high energy rockabilly as only the Stray Cats can.
    Director:
    Not Available

  • African Cats (2011)

    An epic true story set against the backdrop of one of the wildest places on Earth, 'African Cats' captures the real-life love, humor and determination of the majestic kings of the Savannah.
    The story features Mara, an endearing lion cub who strives to grow up with her mother's strength, spirit and wisdom; Sita, a fearless cheetah and single mother of five mischievous newborns; and Fang, a proud leader of the pride who must defend his family from a rival lion and his sons.
    Director:
    Alastair Fothergill
    Cast:
    Samuel L. Jackson, Patrick Stewart
    Formats:
    Sign up

  • Puss in Boots (2011)

    You loved him in Shrek - now see where the one-and-only swashbuckling feline found his fame - and a very big pair of boots - in the animated epic! Lover, fighter and outlaw Puss In Boots (Antonio Banderas) is off on the adventure of his nine lives as he teams up with Kitty Softpaws (Salma Hayek)
    and Humpty Dumpty (Zach Galifianakis) for the ultimate showdown with the notorious Jack and Jill (Billy Bob Thornton and Amy Sedaris). Here's the true story of The Cat, The Myth, The Legend - Puss In Boots!
    Director:
    Chris Miller
    Cast:
    Antonio Banderas, Salma Hayek, Zach Galifianakis

  • Cats and Dogs 2: The Revenge of Kitty Galore (2010)

    Former elite agent Kitty Galore plans to unleash a diabolical device designed to not only bring her canine enemies to heel but also to take down her former kitty comrades and make the world her scratching post.
    Cats and dogs must now join forces for the first time ever to prevent a global cat-astrophe.
    Director:
    Brad Peyton
    Cast:

  • Animal Planet: Big Cats: Amba the Russian Tiger (2010)

    Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan heads to Eastern Russia on his most challenging trip to date, as he goes in search of the Russian tiger.
    The beautiful and unknown area of Ussuriland is his destination which has the largest unbroken area of forest with the single largest population of tigers anywhere in the world. This incredible film tells Gordon's story as he sets out to find and film the tiger of the Russian Far East. Vladivostok, where he begins his search is bleak and bitterly cold with no sign of any wildlife. Gordon has the help of Anatoly Petrov who has spent much time in these forests and is one of the few people who has seen a wild tiger.
    Director:
    Saritha Wilkinson
    Cast:
    Gordon Buchanan
    Formats:
    Sign up

  • Animal Planet: Big Cats: White Lions: King of Kings (2005)

    The lion is the symbol of power, royalty, magic and mysticism. Today, the King of the Beasts is under threat. In the past 20 years, the world's lion population has plummeted 90% from 250,000 to 23,000. And these, just 70 were born white.
    White Lions are not albinos - they are the same as all other lions, except for one small genetic anomaly, an abnormality that makes them very rare and incredibly valuable. In an effort to help ensure the survival of these species, two sets of white lions are taken from their home in South Africa to their new home at Mogo Zoo in Australia.
    Director:
    David Adams
    Cast:
    Not Available
    Formats:
    Sign up
